website_summaries.verdict: Some design choices get in the way of function, but for comfort and sound quality the Cloud Revolver S is sunshine on a rainy day.
pros: The Cloud Revolver S is unfairly, obscenely comfortable
It's like wearing two sound pillows on your face
cons: Missing the on-ear buttons of a lot of other headsets makes mid-game muting and volume tweaks a bit of a pain

customer_reviews.title: Will not last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first headset on March 27, 2017 and they were perfectly fine. Great sound quality, microphone was amazing, and they were comfortable. Fast forward 7 months and the stitching on the earphone ripped. Another month and the other earphone stitching ripped. By the one year mark I figured I would give them another try because they were on sale. $149.99 -> $129.41 Bought the 2nd pair on April 7, 2018 and its now November 23, 2018 and the earphone stitching has ripped again. I would advise purchasing a different headphone if you want long lasting ones. Although great, they will not last more than a year if your lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: This product itself is great, Kingston makes these headsets feel premium without a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second HyperX headset I have purchased. The original HyperX's mic started making static every time I had moved it. This product itself is great, Kingston makes these headsets feel premium without a huge price tag. I am a bit let down however that this is their flagship headset but the older versions have more accessories. The headset is geared towards gamers but it is a bit subtle and sleek in its design. The comfort level on this headset is great! I can wear for hours on end and it feels light yet is securely on your head. I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Bill V.

customer_reviews.title: Shocked me....literally
customer_reviews.text: I rated them 2 stars because In fairness, i purchased a refurbished headset, but refurbished should mean checked and certified right? The sound was great for about two weeks and then would short circuit (or something) and shock/electrocute my ears and killed the picture (black out) on my PS4 for about 5 seconds before returning, Not a pleasurable experience! I sent them back and went with the Cloud II's, which to be honest do not sound as good as the Revolver S, and do not have working inline controls like the Revolver on PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and Comfortable - for us quality better than Razer Kraken Tournament
customer_reviews.text: The sound and microphone are great quality and my son says they are really comfortable. He uses these for gaming, virtual learning, talking on his phone, and listening to music. The adapter so you can switch between USB for his laptop and 3.5 mm for his phone makes this really convenient. My son got this to replace his Razer Kraken Tournament Edition THX 7.1. We had bought that and had to replace it due to sound issues and the microphone going in and out, and the microphone had stopped working on the replacement pair a few weeks in. My son likes the HyperX much more and says it is more comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Beverley

customer_reviews.title: Great headset, though the headband is awkward
customer_reviews.text: The sound and overall quality of the headset is excellent! My one gripe (and the reason I only gave 4 stars) is that the headband uses a tension system to hold itself in place, and it isn't very helpful if you have a smaller or more narrow head shape. It can place some of the weight on your ears instead of your head. Also, some people mention hitting the metal part of the headband makes noise that you can hear--which is true, though I don't find myself hitting the metal (and don't see this as a problem).
customer_reviews.author: Ric Crooks

customer_reviews.title: Can't hear footsteps very well with....
customer_reviews.text: Its Comfortable the first few hours, then my ears starting to feel it pushing. noise canceling is ok, not great. Very well built and feel expensive. Keep losing connection to pc, distortion mic/ muffle (solution is to unplug and plug it back) and Discord won't detect it sometimes. Had a replacement, and the 2nd one still doing the same problem. Waiting for software update.... Sound quality is good until it's come to gaming, I'm having problem hearing footsteps in FPS gaming like PUBG, COD... Especially when Dolby activated, Update 2020: had to get external to fix the mic distortion permanently. The footsteps in FPS haven't improve through software update. I Do not recommend these headset for gamers.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse Deals !!Sick!! Cheap for a Reason.
customer_reviews.text: Got the headphones from amazon warehouse deals. Well there's a reason they were $65.00. Headphones came with all paperwork accessories and boxes. The headphones work. Whoever returned these had a serious hygiene problem. Headband came with dandruff and ear cushions came with salt soaked sweat marks and the inner fabric that protects the speakers were covered in ear wax... Not just a little bit. I'm talking completely caked with yellow ear wax. Absolutely disgusting. I cleaned everything, the headphones are usable. Most people who return a product like this. Fair warning if your order from warehouse deals expect getting a pair of headphones in this condition.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Big head=GOOD, Small Head=Strained ears. Sound is great! Still love them.
customer_reviews.text: I love the headset, and the fact that my CPU already has this processor/software on my laptop, this still makes my stereo sound better! The Headset is a bit heavy, if you dont have a big head it puts a bit of strain on your ears. Im looking into a way to modify it to sit properly on my head. The reason this is Fail is due to the elastic or whatever they use in the headband is just not strong enough to hold the headset up. It droops down and rests on the top of my ears. Strain on the ears but great sound quality, Expected a bit more but works for what i wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Pen pall 2232

customer_reviews.title: Only one negative thing i found..
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning the unit because it lacked one feature, on its built in inline processor there is no way to balance chat with game audio. The headphones sound great and are really comfortable also the Mic is clear sounding . Having the 7.1 Dolby is a big plus. The only negative thing I found was if you hit the metal headband even slightly it produces annoying sounds.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: good but hurt my inner ears
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for less than a year and I can no longer use them because they cause my inner ears to hurt despite listening to music or gaming at LOWEST sound settings. I have used these headphones for at least 4 hours a day everyday. The sound quality was good overall and I have nothing complain about but if you'll be using these headphones for prolonged times, I would not recommend them. The microphone would not work when I connected the headset with the USB and had to use the regular cables. I would not recommend these to anyone based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kacper

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for long use, surround sound is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Never really had a need for a gaming headset before I bought this, so this is my first. That said the sound quality is good, the surround sound is amazing, the mic works well, and it is comfortablefor longer gaming sessions. I bought this mainly to play COD online with some of my old army buddies, and I'm rather impressed with how well the surround sound feature works on this headset. It very clearly indicates directionality of sounds which has upped my game over my standard 2 channel computer speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headset *while tethered* for the PS4/PC.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is amazing. Noise canceling and flexible mic is awesome. Extremely comfortable for hours at a time (Even while wearing glasses). Very sturdy. My wife and I both have one for gaming. As gamers, we both love this headset. We do not use them wirelessly. The 7.1 surround sound is only available while plugged into the decoder and I tried talking wirelessly with my family and they said noise cancelling is much better while wired (We have 2 toddlers wreaking havoc in the background at any given time).
customer_reviews.author: Mystchyphe

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my little brother's birthday and this is his review "OMG I TESTED THEM OUT THEY HAVE A THING ON GOOGLE WHERE U CAN HEAR YOURSELF AND IT SOUNDS CHRYSTAL CLEAR". To get the microphone to work make sure you go into your setting and make the headset your default. It took a little while with tech support to figure out the microphone. They looked amazing and he said they were super comfortable, he said they were so comfortable they were made for his ears.
customer_reviews.author: WilleighNilleigh

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but OK sound
customer_reviews.text: They're OK. The frequency response is pretty far from great. It's alright on the low end, pretty horrible on the high end. My cheap buds had a better frequency response. Also, no matter how I position these on my, everything sounds like it's coming from behind compared to my cheap buds. That said, these headphones are extremely comfortable and I appreciate the flexible and detachable mic. There is plenty of cord length and I like being able to use either USB or the traditional 3.5mm plug. They also seem fairly well put together. It'd see a 4 or 5 stars from me if the sound was better and they sealed off noise a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not when using it's supplied soundcard
customer_reviews.text: As the title says. I found using the supplied usb soundcard, the sound was terrible. You can't really adjust anything. Surround on/off 3 buttons bass mids or high, that's it. Using my internal sound on my PC I can adjust everything and the headphones sound great. Don't hurt my head with glasses on, don't get near as hot as my Logitech's did. So 3 stars for not making a supplied sound card that doesn't sound like crap. Headphones themselves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Canman

customer_reviews.title: There is a hum/buz in the headset which the company refuses to acknowledge
customer_reviews.text: There is a hum/buz in the headset which the company refuses to acknowledge, even though it has been documented on other web sites. The sound/mic is very good overall, much better than other headsets. I went with their other headset that does not have the USB dac/controller. It also has a hum but only in the recorded audio from the mic, which I found to preferable than listening to this buzzing in my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Tethyss

customer_reviews.title: Prefer Cloud Alpha, but good headset
customer_reviews.text: I’ll keep this short. I prefer my Cloud Alpha to this headset simply because of the design and fit of the headset on MY head. I found the suspension mechanism to be less than secure, especially compared to other headsets with a suspension headband. Also, I would have liked the 3.5mm jack to have been significantly longer before the surround sound extension, just Incase someone wants to use this in something like an Astro Mixamp and not a USB device. Sounds great though, and looks great. Probably would fit a bigger head well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I've owned turtle beaches, corsair, Logitech, and recently even used the Audeze Mobius. This headset out performs the $400 Audeze Mobius in terms of sound, and surround sound. With surround sound enabled on these it makes you feel like you're alone in a room with speakers around the walls with you in the center, you can hear the distance of the speakers with this surround sound, all the other surround sound headsets I've owned, including the Audeze Mobius the speakers feel like they're directly on top you instead of giving you space. To me that doesn't feel like a theatre experience; and doesn't help with positional queues in video-games.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent performance
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the deal is but works great on console, however voice quality on PC is absolute garbage. That really sucks cause I got this for my son and most of his gaming is on pc. Don’t understand why it works great with Xbone & PS4 yet awful with pc? If he tries voice recordings on pc it’s fine, but in game his mic sounds like mud? Whatever just use it on my xbone.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound, decent mic, band is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound, decent mic, band is terrible They aren't audiophile-grade and the mic is passable, but they both sound pretty decent. Unfortunately, the band broke just after the warranty ran out. There are small bungee cords on the left/right of the lower band that shock absorb/adjust to the correct height on your ears. Both sides either overstretched or became disconnected inside the band. Now it will just slide down to where the lower band touches the top and is uncomfortable. The build quality is 5/10.
customer_reviews.author: Raylene Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Revolver S - Great Material Quality - Poor Fit for Smaller Heads
customer_reviews.text: Materials look and feel great. Even the box is substantial. However, the head band is not manually adjustable and fits to loose for smaller or thinner heads. The self adjusting head band is made well, it just doesn't have one size fits all. For smaller heads the headset slips down your head until the earcups are resting on the tops of your ears. I didn't even plug them up before returning them. Very sad - otherwise they are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: CANDICE OSBORNE

customer_reviews.title: They are decent, read review if you game on console
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a mute button when I use them on Xbox and that's annoying at this price point. For laptop use I have controls. They do have passive noise cancelling, it's not as good as Bose but it works. Sound quality, the surround sound is decent. I can tell where footsteps are coming from. There is some crackle in the sound. Maybe it's the Xbox or maybe its the headphones. I'd go with a different set for gaming on a console without the mute button.
customer_reviews.author: jachansen

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using for a couple of months now and I have to say these are way worth the price! The surround sound is like having everything play out in your living room, but can be turned to stereo with a push of a button. You can mute easily, and change the volume and mic volume easily. Sounds are crisp, basses are deep. Explosions are pretty epic and you can clearly hear footsteps coming from the correct directions. Recommending them to all of my online friends who need new headsets!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Van Havermaet

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation could be better. That's it.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price. Best set of headphones I've ever owned. I used to buy the $20 Chinese garbage sets every couple months, and I finally got tired of that first bought the Razer LE Tournament Edition. That was *horrible*. Honestly pure trash headset. It died after a couple months, so I got these. Best headset decision I ever made. Easy to use, flawless quality, great construction.
customer_reviews.author: Rawr!

customer_reviews.title: Not great but not horrible.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is fine. I hoped they might be a step up over my older Corsair headsets for the price. They are not. My biggest grievance is the ear pad and the sloppy way the head set sits on my head. The ears dig into my jaw and the head carriage does not support the weight of the head set and it rests on the top of me ears getting very very uncomfortable after a couple hours of use. This product does not meet my expectations at all. Will probably stick with my corsairs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo Girl 2005

customer_reviews.title: Very large band but work well
customer_reviews.text: If your head isn't a bobblehead, then these are gonna be large for you. They do prevent me from hearing things around me, and the 7.1 and stereo sound is good, amd directional. I had to make a piece to stop the huge band from allowing the ear cups to slide down and push on my ears. Not worth 140. Thats the 4 star. They would be a 5 star at 100, maybe 110. If the band was diferent and/or they were wireless, then they would be worth 140, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: MakeCents

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great Headset Pros - the design is very stylish Ear pads are comfortable. Sound - the sound is good specially with the sound card with Dolby 7.1 sorrund sound and also has 3 different EQ preset if you would like to listen music. Cons - they tend to get heavy after hours of used but you can get used to it. At times you get static or pop from other people mic. The headband tend to lose tension after extensive used. The metal band make noise when you hit it (maybe if you intent to reach over your head to scratch it )you can hear even if you got your volume cranked up.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Cord defective.  Microphone died after very light use for a year.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones fit well, sounded good. But the mic died early on. I could jiggle the cable now and then to get it to work but my friends usually just said I sound broken up and like a robot. Was not a software or setting issue. Been gaming for 4 decades. It is the cable. So now I just use them when I don't need to communicate. I use my 100 year old rattly microsoft mic for speech.
customer_reviews.author: RedLeader

customer_reviews.title: They do make a great headphone
customer_reviews.text: Best fitting headphones I've ever owned and the quality of workmanship is second to none. but now the price and that is a bit pricey , also do not attempt to plug it into a USB 3.0 port ain't going to work but their literature and online reviews say nothing about this so let me be the first. One more thing I thought it'd be a heck of a lot louder then it is. Gonna keep the though.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: My headset came with a couple issues. 1. The left ear has a somewhat frequent and very annoying pop sound. I tried using the hedset in different devices, usb ports etc. but nothing works. 2. The headset sometimes randomly powers off and wont work until I unplug and plug it back in. 3. This one is a little more nitpicking but the surround sound was very underwhelming. With surround sound on the quality severly degraded and I personally could not hear much of a difference from stereo. I took a chance at buying a more expensive headset and was very dissapointed in what I got. I would not reccomend this headset under any circumstance.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Hicks

customer_reviews.title: They work.... I guess
customer_reviews.text: They sound good but..... They feel very loose when you put them on so it wasn't really noise cancelling, they feel fragile, and the worst part is.... *back story* I live in a second story apartment with carpet and with a washer and dryer so I get staticky.... This headset is not static friendly. I've been shocked on my ears sooooo many times that I chose to not use this at all. If the static thing wasn't an issue I would probably have more input and better feedback about the headset but because I couldn't use it without being shocked.... I have to give this headset a 2 out of 5.... Sorry guys.. I'm sure it's good
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Static background noise
customer_reviews.text: Memory foam is compfortable and light hanging on your ear only for short duration wear say two hours then hurts my ear. USB dolby 7.1 audio sounds same as stereo just amplified. Constant static noise whether dolby is on or off, even under lowest volume. Under 3.5mm jack the static noise is still there but less noticeable. Bought this for the dolby but was dissapointed. Worth it? No.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Just WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 15 YO gamer after going through several cheaper sets in no time flat. Man oh man these things are GREAT. I tried them on and the sound is awesome, built strong and comfortable, the removable mic is the perfect touch for him because he seems to break those fast. Highly recommend these for your gamer. However, do not try to speak to them until they remove at least 1 earpiece because they will not hear you.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Flora

customer_reviews.title: Okay sound, mic problems
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound in the headset, but I did notice a little bit of white noise. Unfortunately I believe my headset came with a defective mic port as no one seems to be able to hear me on both PC and PS4. I called Kingston customer support and they were very nice and knowledgeable, and even overnighted me a new mic. The new mic did not resolve my issue and so I returned the headset to Amazon. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: philbobagginzz

customer_reviews.title: Headset
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for some months now and figured I'd write a review. (PC) The sound quality of the headset is of pretty good quality, however, it runs very quiet and does a poor job of isolating outside noise. In addition, wires/plugs on the headset wear out rather quickly, and fall out of their sockets for constant annoyance. The preset sound options are useless, as they only make the sound shift to a certain part of the headset (Front/back etc). Summed up, the headset as not impressed me enough to justify the price. I've played with a variety of high end to low end headsets and this one seems to be on the lower end of the spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Tj Cirone

customer_reviews.title: This headset literally shocked me.
customer_reviews.text: Google this headset, multiple people have mentioned that as it gets older it will sometimes zap your ears. I wish I was kidding. What a surprise that was the first time. For the first few months of heavy use (I'm an audio engineer on top of being an avid gamer) I was pretty happy with these despite the surround sound being a little tinny. This is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy for PS4 or PC not for Xbox
customer_reviews.text: So I'm an Xbox and pc gamer and when I used these for Xbox I was saddened with it. It was better than my old pair of turtle beaches but I couldn't turn up/down or mute myself from the headset. But when I use this on PC lets me hear a mouse from across a house. I swear this helps so much for gaming. Only 4 stars because I can't game for too long just because the headset gets heavy and doesn't let my ears breath enough.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for more comfortable headphones that I could wear for hours without them bothering my ears. As soon as I put these ones on I was disappointed due to the fit. The headset auto-adjusts the size to your head, leaving them very loose on your head and ears. If you look up or down the headset slips in the direction you are looking. The sound seems to be pretty good though.
customer_reviews.author: knight train

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset
customer_reviews.text: I would first like to say that sound wise these are incredible for gaming. Which is my main use for them. My biggest complaint about these. Which isn’t actually that big. Is that the controls for volume and mute are attached to the cord with no way to adjust where on the cord it is. They have it to far down. If they could make it somehow adjustable that would really help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sound quality wasn't the greatest, not much low end
customer_reviews.text: worked fairly well from the start. sound quality wasn't the greatest, not much low end. but after a couple months the headset started shorting out. at first the mic was always open despite having configured windows to keep it closed. then the headset began to literally send small shocks of electricity onto my ears. Shortly after that the speakers began to turn on and off randomly but consistantly. Never once was this headset dropped nor were the cables ever stressed. I would never recommend purchasing these and since this is my first experience with a Hyperx product i will not be buying hardware from this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: These are probably the best headset
customer_reviews.text: Sound is a beast! And the sound changing options on the little control panel really help to get you the sound you need for that specific game. Whether you need FPS game accuracy hearing, specific hearings for MOBA abilities, or just to enjoy an amazing soundtrack, they're great. Oh, and for those glasses users such as me (really advanced myopia) I have to say that they don't push neither the temple nor the temple tips towards your head, so headaches aren't really a problem to a more-than-8-hours PC user guy like me.
customer_reviews.author: Ayano

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by the audio range
customer_reviews.text: From 1st person shooters where every foot step needs to be heard to dropping the base on the latest remix. My first day owning this headset has been nothing but pleasure. The 3 preset sound profiles are ok, but turning on the dolby surround sound is where this headset really opened up and put you in the middle of whatever you are listening too. The cord length was great, usb plug n play and a removable mic are very nice features.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Fixed the white noise static by updating drivers
customer_reviews.text: So at first there was a lot of white noise and it was horrible to the point I bought the cloud II ones but then those had horrible bass and tearing sound so i stayed with the revolver S because the sound is a lot crisper and clear. Today I updated my audio drivers and the white noise is gone. These are awesome now super clean and surround is awesome. Much better than the cloud II in my opinion, soundwise comfort etc update your drivers it might help. I got a z390 I motherboard btw
customer_reviews.author: JETZAP

customer_reviews.title: Not size adjustable 🥺
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these but they have one serious design oversight. Pros: Good quality sound. Mutable sound from cord Detachable mic Cons: Not size adjustable (I thought it wouldn't be an issue but it is when I have to readjust the headset every 30-60 minutes) Really long cord? Really just not having the ability to adjust the size makes these not worth it. I have the cheaper? Version of these the cloud x and they are adjustable. Not sure why they decided that wasn't a useful feature. Two stars because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: PlayStation and PC only (Not for Xbox)
customer_reviews.text: Great quality headset, but 2 cons in my opinion. 1) the part that sets on your head is not very snug, which causes more of the weight to be on the tops of your ears. Not the most comfortable headset. 2) Do not buy for XBOX. This headset is made for usb compatible devices (Xbox Is not, PlayStation/PC are). This means on Xbox, you cannot use the cord with the surround sound configurations on it, which mean there is no button, besides in Xbox audio settings, to mute or control volume. Again, pretty good quality, but not an Xbox product.
customer_reviews.author: Judy H.

customer_reviews.title: Suits me
customer_reviews.text: I had read good things about this headset so I bought it and the only negative that I have is the inline DSP gets pretty warm but it sounds great, good build quality, self leveling headband, detachable mic, fairly lightweight definitely comfortable. The soft pleather covering of the earcups is nice but remains to be seen as far as flaking off like most do. I am well pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good audio quality but extremely uncomfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: Headband does not stay in the fixed position. It's held by these extremely weak springs that let it slide all over your head. The end result is that the cups are only supported by clipping to your ears making anything more than 1 hour gaming session extremely uncomfortable. Quality of the headset is fine as is the featureset. If it weren't for the comfort issues I'd call it excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the most comfortable pair of headphones that I've ever worn. I can game several hours and not even notice that I have a headset on. The sound is great and the 7.1 is of course a bonus. I also really like the fact that the adapter can clip onto a pocket or belt buckle for easy adjustment of volume, mic level and stereo to 7.1ch conversion. My only con is that they are a little expensive but the quality is top notch and totally worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. (Read for more Detail)
customer_reviews.text: So, the headset itself sounds good, but the quality of the physical equipment is poor. The cable is kinked in many places within a couple of months of having it. It came that way and some of the wires have poked through the cloth coverings already. A plastic bit has popped off of the headset already and the cable that allows for surround sound is overheating from first use. I purchased this because I heard the quality of the company was generally good, and am very dissapointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jewell

customer_reviews.title: USB Sound Card static SOLVED!!
customer_reviews.text: I, like many others here, had brutal static when using the USB sound card (which is the reason I selected this model). The solution turned out to be to go to the Hyperx support site and download the firmware update. Oddly, if you are like me, you will already have the most current firmware version, but if you proceed it will reflash that same version and solve the problem. So I guess there are a bunch of improperly flashed sound cards in the channel. 3 stars for putting me through this and putting defective product in the channel. I will limit my review to this since so many other people are having the issue with no obvious solution posted anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: William T Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headset
customer_reviews.text: The surround sound is good but I'll get a little static noise in the background. Otherwise this is a good gaming headset. I'm able to hear people I talk with very clearly and I'm told my voice sounds very clear and loud. Very comfortable headset. Aside from that minor static noise I get I wouldve gave this headset a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this headset. I have had no issues with it thus far, the build and audio quality is all that I would've hoped for. I highly suggest it. My only complaint is that the headset doesn't really have size adjustments, after wearing them for a long time I've noticed that the tops of my ears are sore from holding the head set in place. It really isn't that bothersome for me but I can see that being an issue for some people, it's not enough of a deterrent to make me want a different headset.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Jones

customer_reviews.title: They work, with a few drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable, but lacking bass. I needed a headset I could wear more than 20 minutes and it would start to hurt my head. These work great. I wish the controls were on the headset side of the Line-In cable, because you can't use this with a PS4/Xbox controller and keep your in-line controls, but since I will mainly use them for PC it doesn't really matter. Given the choice, I would probably buy something else, but I got these as a Amazon Warehouse buy at a huge discount, so I will be keeping them.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but the quality of the item is questionable

customer_reviews.title: Missing features for xbox one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the main purpose to use it for my xbox one, only to find out that it only supports it via the controller 3.5mm connection rather than via USB for the full quality and feature range. I am so disappointed that even if the dongle isn't supported that maybe it should bring one that does... maybe one that has 3.5mm for party chat and optical for the console itself. Now i am unsure of whether or not i am going to be keeping this because of the short comings. I love the quality and feel but not getting the full virtual 7.1 dolby surround is a deal breaker, on top of not having the dongle controls.

customer_reviews.title: Great headset but mine has a weird USB 3.0 defect.
customer_reviews.text: Day 1: Got my headset, great packaging if not a bit wasteful. Plugged the USB dongle into my PC, which was already turned on. Changed some windows sound settings. I was playing games and talking to friends just great the rest of the night. Day 2: Turn on PC. Wouldn't boot. Wouldn't even allow me to get to the BIOS configuration. After some troubleshooting, I found out my computer won't start up properly if the USB dongle for this headset is plugged into any USB 3.0 port. It works fine and PC boots fine if I use any other (not 3.0) USB port. That's weird but it still works.

So get a warranty or make sure they are not popping.

They are better in every way except comfort, but I expect the Revolver S to stop being comfortable in about 5 months, as the headband already shows signs of wear and tear, and is FAR to loose.

customer_reviews.title: Best headphone for the money

The sound is excellent, and the surround sound feature is excellent. It's just strange that there's a button for surround when it should be on the entire time. The only negative I have is that once in a blue moon the left headphone will make a barely noticeable poop/crack/tick sound. I've read it can be solved by re-installing drivers, but I've yet to do it.

I unplug it and set it to the side and looked up the issue, finding out other people have had this issue with some having their boxes melt from the inside. I have emailed HyperX support, I'll update this review as I email with them, but for the time being I'm keeping it a one star as this could be safety and fire hazard.

product_meta.title: HyperX Cloud Revolver S Gaming Headset with Dolby 7.1 Surround Sound for PC, PS4, PS4 PRO, Xbox One, Xbox One S (HX-HSCRS-GM/NA)
product_meta.description: HyperX Cloud Revolver S features Plug N Play virtual Dolby Surround 7. 1 audio — no software required. The USB digital signal processing card outputs consistent high-quality sound no matter what system you're using. Revolver S has a flappable audio control box so you can quickly Push-to-Dolby, mute and regulate mic/output levels. Signature HyperX memory foam and the wider headband provide even greater award-winning comfort. TeamSpeak and Discord certified, Revolver S ensures you'll always have clear communication. If you’re serious about gaming, you need a headset that will give you the maximum competitive advantage. The HyperX Cloud Revolver line is premium-grade gear, meticulously designed to meet the demands of the elite PC gamer. Next-gen drivers separate out the lows, mids, and highs to crank out precisely positioned, high-quality sound. The Revolver family has stereo and Plug-N-Play Dolby 7.1 Surround models, which both feature studio-grade sound stages and next-gen drivers that excel in FPS and open environment settings. Both headsets feature durable solid-steel frames, and signature HyperX memory foam for award-winning comfort. Cloud Revolver is the headset to choose if you’re looking for top-tier comfort, audio quality and clear communication.
